description: Although I am able to authenticate, I am unable to proceed to my workspace. Amazon prevents me from doing so and issues a message - "The current version of your Amazon workspaces client isn't compatible with the agent software installed on your workspace. Update to the latest version of your client." This version was released back in November of 2023 according to Amazon release notes. It is just too old.

$ flatpak run com.amazon.Workspaces 
bwrap: execvp workspacesclient: No such file or directory

I had to downgrade to 2024-05-16. Otherwise works fine.
Convenient packaging for AWS WorkSpace client. Previously I had a podman container building from Ubuntu for this.
summary: Convenient packaging for AWS WorkSpace client

description:
Any attempt to install latest version (meaning March 2021) ends on a 403:Forbidden error when attempting to download the source package from AWS Cloudfront

Probably the download code needs some tweaking
summary: Convenient but in the last 4-5 days the download fails

description: Finally no worries about converting ubuntu debs via alien. This works great!

I'm so happy this is available and can use it on steam deck! Works very fast and well, incl audio meetings!
I noticed one issue so far only: whenever the client loses connection to the desktop ("session interrupted") clicking "disconnect workspace" does not do anything. In fact, the whole app freezes (not responding(, cannot close it out via the X button either.

Unfortunately Amazon's default policy only allows Workspace clients from Mac, Windows, IOS and Android but not Linux and Web and I couldn't get my company to change the setting so when I enter my registration code I get unauthorised, making this useless not for a technical reason but a stupid management issue. Amazon please fix you policy!
summary: Glad it exists wish I could use it

description:
There are missing features from the Windows version (like direct hardware passthrough) that are important for things like FIPS yubikey. It also feels like the windows version works better and is more polished while this may be a lighter wrapper around the web delivered stream protocol. Am I wrong? Maybe. It works really well for what it does when you're the end-point resource consumer. 

I think this is 4/5 stars but I'm going to give it 5 stars to balance out the silly "I hate amazon" review.
summary: Works well as a consumer of workspaces, needs work to be perfect

description: Works well enough on a single monitor display. One star off because it fails to use multiple monitors when "Enter Full Screen on All Displays" is selected.
This desperately needs updated. It doesn't work with modern AWS WorkSpaces including Ubuntu.
summary: Does not work with WSP workspaces

description:
It works, so there's that. It needs a serious overhaul by Amazon. I've been using Amazon WorkSpaces for two and a half years, FYI.

- Linux client only works on Flatpak, for me.
- Copy and paste from native Linux Desktop to AWS Desktop doesn't work, you can only copy and paste within the Virtual Windows Desktop.
- Super slow response time, no matter how fast your internet connection is.

Amazon, get your $#!t together.

A big thank you to the Flatpak engineers who built this app. It works great!
However, there is no option to copy and paste between the host computer and the Workspaces client.
For reference, I'm using AWS Workspaces on a Mac. Interestingly, the Linux Flatpak version of the app is more stable and performs faster, especially at Full HD resolution. 4K also works well, but with some slight lag.
Funciona perfectamente y hace todo lo que tiene que hacer. Muchas gracias
